intro: Dubois-reymondia hystrix, commonly known as the spiny papyrus, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and distinctive, spiny bracts that surround its flowering spikes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense clusters. The species is adapted to wetland environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
